issues.title: Requests that span more than one TCP packet are misinterpreted.
issues.body:
If one makes a request to a server that is large (say, larger than the current MTU), and it is broken up in the network, the second packet will get misinterpreted as a new request and does all sorts of nutty things, depending on what data overflows into the subsequent packets. 

I suspect that multiple requests in the same packet may be ignored.

issues.title: unhandled exceptions in zktraffic/base/sniffer.py handle_packet
issues.body:
in sniffer.py, if there are exceptions that aren't specifically called out, the daemon just quits without logging anything.  I'm specifically seeing StringTooLong exceptions, but there may be others.

It looks like this was addressed in omni_sniffer, catching any other exceptions in the handle_packet method:

``` python
    except Exception as ex:
      print("got: %s" % str(ex))
      hexdump.hexdump(packet.load)
      traceback.print_exc()
      sys.stdout.flush()
```

We are working on a fix, but it may take some time here to put together a pull request.

issue_comments.body: Pull request added!
this doesn't fix the problem.  redoing this.

issues.title: Expose counters for distinct (i.e.: data, exists, children) watches set with SetWatchesRequest
SetWatchesRequest not appearing in /json/paths
issues.body:
This is similar to what happened with Multi() request, we need to either pick the first one or convert something like:

```
SetWatchesRequest(/foo, /bar)
```

into

```
SetWatchesRequest(/foo)
SetWatchesRequest(/bar)
```

so that we account correctly (albeit, at the expense of more mem).

commits.message:
Release 0.1.8

Signed-off-by: Raul Gutierrez Segales <rgs@itevenworks.net>

fix(accumulators): treat unset paths like /

Some requests have no paths associated (i.e.: Connect). While
others might have multiple paths (i.e.: SetWatches). For
consistency, if the path is not set treat it as /.

feature(zk-stats-daemon): add --exclude-bytes

This new flag is useful when you want to reduce the number
of exported metrics via /json/paths. With it, only number
of requests per path and type will be exported.

refactor(accumulators): make bytes accounting optional

We have a use case in which we only care about the number of requests,
but not the total sizes. This makes this accounting optional.

The next step is to wire this up from stats_daemon.py.
refactor(accumulators): remove unused log.debug calls

Release 0.1.7

Signed-off-by: Raul Gutierrez Segales <rgs@itevenworks.net>

feature(zk-stats-daemon): add support for --sampling

Analyzing every packet is probably too much CPU usage
for most cases. It's easy to get an idea of which
paths are the busiest by inspecting a decent sized
sample (i.e.: 10% of packets).

This can now be done via:

```
ZKTRAFFIC_SOURCE=1 bin/zk-stats-daemon \
  --iface=eth0 \
  --http-port=9090 \
  --http-address=127.0.0.1 \
  --set-cpu-affinity=0 \
  --sampling=0.1
```

refactor(sniffer): delay calling intern()

Via perf top I saw a few calls that look to be
triggered via the excessive calls to intern().

This avoids calling intern() for packets that'll
potentially be ignored.

fix(loaders): wake up less often

Two potential improvements here:

* no need to process stats _every_ time a new message
  arrives. It's fine to do it with a 1 sec granularity
* given that we don't wait on the condition var anymore,
  there is no need to lock/notify when a new message
  is added

I did some observations via:

```
perf stat -e 'syscalls:sys_enter_*' -p $pid sleep 2
```

and the result is that we now see more (not consistently though)
done (i.e.: more packets picked up by calling sys_enter_recvfrom).

fix(stats_daemon): don't wake up every 10 secs

Calling join() on the sniffer thread is much better
than waking up every 10 secs...
fix(stats-daemon): call set_cpu_affinity() before spawning threads
fix(requirements): add missing dep ansicolors

Signed-off-by: Raul Gutierrez S <rgs@twitter.com>

fix(zab): display zxids as hex

A zxid is a long (64 bits), of which the highest
32 bits are the epoch and the lower 32 bits are
the transaction id. Having it be in hex makes
it easier to read these two and correlate with
logs.

Signed-off-by: Raul Gutierrez S <rgs@twitter.com>

fix(opcodes): createSession's opcode was missing

Now, when running zab-dump you can see `createSession`
as opposed to the opcode (i.e.: -10):

```
$ sudo ZKTRAFFIC_SOURCE=1 bin/zab-dump --iface=lo --port 20022
...
Request(
 cxid=0,
 dst=127.0.0.1:20022,
 length=40,
 req_type=CreateSession,
 session_id=0x1001daa5da30004,
 src=127.0.0.1:37846,
 timestr=12:21:55:700390,
 zxid=-1,
)
```

Signed-off-by: Raul Gutierrez S <rgs@twitter.com>

Release 0.1.5

Signed-off-by: Raul Gutierrez S <rgs@twitter.com>

feature(zk-dump): add support for profiling latencies by path/type

This adds two new flags to zk-dump:

* --measure-latency to collect & report per path/type latencies
* --aggregation-depth to do this per aggregated path

This is quite useful to find slow operations, specially
for x-DC clusters.

feature(zk-dump): add --count-requests and --sort-by

This is useful to avoid resorting to awk/sed to get
a quick count of what's going on.

A few example:

$ sudo ZKTRAFFIC_SOURCE=1 bin/zk-dump --iface=eth0 --count-requests 10000 --sort-by path
/ 1749
/services/prod/search 846
/configs/teleportation/features 843

Or by type:

$ sudo ZKTRAFFIC_SOURCE=1 bin/zk-dump --iface=eth0 --count-requests 10000 --sort-by type
GetChildrenRequest 9044
ExistsRequest 958

that.

Merge pull request #18 from Yasumoto/exclude_include_tests

Add tests for including and excluding IPs

Release 0.1.2

Signed-off-by: Raul Gutierrez S <rgs@itevenworks.net>

Add support for excluding/including IPs in zk-dump

Sometimes you only care about sniffing traffic to a given cluster. This
commit adds an option for that:

$ sudo zk-dump --iface lo --include-host some-cluster.domain.tld

When using the --include-host flag, only requests to and from the A and AAAA
records backing some-cluster.domain.tld will be captured.

Similarly, you could be interested in capturing all ZK traffic on a box
_except_ for what's going to a given cluster:

$ sudo zk-dump --iface lo --exclude-host some-cluster.domain.tld

Both flags can be used multiple times to include or exclude more than one
host. Though you can't mix include and exclude flags.

Signed-off-by: Raul Gutierrez S <rgs@twitter.com>

zk-dump: add --unpaired options

By default, zk-dump will wait for a reply from the server
to be seen and then it'll pair that with the request that
it saw before.

This new option, --unpaired, prints reqs, reps & evts as soon
as they are seen. This loses the order, but can be helpful
to debug certain timeouts & other scenarios.

Note, note, note: we are still subject to the whatever ordering
pcap sees from the Kernel. So absolute ordering, as what's seen
through the wire, isn't assured (but it probably gets close enough).

Signed-off-by: Raul Gutierrez S <rgs@twitter.com>

Move bits to zktraffic.cli so scripts can be pex-ified

Signed-off-by: Raul Gutierrez S <rgs@twitter.com>

Fix manifest, pex fails without this

issue_comments.body:
done: https://github.com/twitter/zktraffic/releases/tag/0.1.0

(though we'll probably do another release soon as we polish some things)
ping (and pinging the pcapy PR too)
most comments addressed, thx @chchen!
@Yasumoto yes please feel free to edit .travis.yml! thx!
il est maintenant fixé, beau monsieur!
you could, but we wouldn't necessarily be able to see it (i.e.: if it expands to more than 1 IP packet, highly likely).
https://github.com/twitter/zktraffic/pull/26
this is partially solved, since we expose the first path in the txn. good enough for now, i guess.
Thanks for the pull request @AkihiroSuda ! It looks good, I added a few comments, let me know if you have any questions!
@AkihiroSuda : let me know if you want more time to get to the review, otherwise I am happy to merge it as is and follow-up with the style fixes in future commits. Thanks!
Merged, thanks @AkihiroSuda !
PEX files will fail without this (because of missing hexdump).
(don't merge yet, more coming)
ping @Yasumoto  :-) (for review, not merging (yet))
gentle follow-up ping :-)
Sure, thanks @AkihiroSuda

Thanks for the pull request @AkihiroSuda ! This generally looks great, only one small nit in https://github.com/AkihiroSuda/zktraffic/commit/fb07a1db2f9c6f7677f47aa9d960f4c719f79a6b with regards to using ABCMeta as a parent of base class (so @abstractmethod can be enforced).

Other than that, it's good to be merged. Thanks!
Merged, thanks @AkihiroSuda !
@AkihiroSuda : could you please review this small improvement?
Thanks @AkihiroSuda ! Next time, try to include a test if you can. Otherwise, I'll add one later on!
Thanks @AkihiroSuda !
This looks great, thank you @AkihiroSuda !
This now works, since rust-zookeeper will now pack the whole request in one write() call.

Sorry for missing this PR @AkihiroSuda ! 

Hmm, are you sure that this is not fixed by https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZOOKEEPER-2098? In other words, you are seeing the message split into multiple packets? How could auto-corking cause that?

cc: @Yasumoto
@AkihiroSuda it's not that hard, I am parsing full TCP streams for https://github.com/pinterest/thrift-tools. It just uses more memory! But we should support his in ZKTraffic soon...

thanks @bensherman !

@Yasumoto : could you please merge this? thanks!

review_comments.body: an option would mean doing imports further down in the file. this is ugly but convenient for running/testing from source so we'll live with it, alas
--diff-word works too! i generally agree, but since it's < 100 cols, leaving it that way for now
ah, left over from debugging! good catch
not, because that's basically ignored. only tick() and a subsequent call to after() can affect it - makes sense?
correct
oops!
it's 0.1.7 - it refers to the unreleased version (hence the -XX)

review_comments.body: Looks like we should call `cpu_affinity` with an argument: https://github.com/giampaolo/psutil/blob/86668f711584df7d6c54689883f15786a4c2d07f/psutil/__init__.py#L673
Could you instead catch OSError and ValueError here instead?https://github.com/giampaolo/psutil/blob/86668f711584df7d6c54689883f15786a4c2d07f/psutil/_pslinux.py#L1081
except (OSError, ValueError) as e:
Maybe `Process helpers used to improve zktraffic's operation.` or something?

Not that you should fix this in this round, but I think we [should use mock](http://mock.readthedocs.org/en/latest/) to enable tests on travis. We (the zktraffic-community) can also have a test suite that can be run when not on travis as well, but let's get this in and pick that up later.

Any chance you can add docstrings? This is [based off sphinx-y formatting](https://pythonhosted.org/an_example_pypi_project/sphinx.html#function-definitions)

(I'm only ~35% sure about this, please correct me where I'm off :)

``` python
"""Set the CPU Affinity for the current process.

:param cpu_affinity_csv: Which CPUs to pin this process to
:type cpu_affinity_csv: string with comma separated values
"""
```
Why this time.sleep? In practice (mainly code in Aurora) I've found anything actually doing a sleep to be pretty flaky.
Does this need a `reset` which sets `_tick = False` ?
Aha. Correct me if I'm off: `reset` sets it up then prepares it for the next run, overriding `tick` just speeds up the process for testing.
delete debugging print
do not want- mind explicitly catching the exceptions you care about here?
I think it's only intended to be verbose if the config is set to dump out "bad packets" so mind deleting this?

commits.message: dnet is needed on OS X
doc(README): mention Linux (>= 3.14) TCP Auto Corking, which especially impedes FLE sniffer
chore(tests): support multiple CIs
tests(packets): cover four-letter packets
tests(parse_config): improve coverage
chore(tests): no coverage for sleep(0.001) and some cli commands
tests(zab): add test for Snap
tests(fle): eliminate needless config
fix(zab): SNAP QuorumPacket was missing
fix(base.sniffer): ignore four-letter packets
fix(omni): flush printer on exit
fix(omni): fix FLE.Initial detection heuristic
fix(omni): use python3 compatible print
fix(base.network): add ABCMeta metaclass to SnifferBase
fix(fle): support Notification v1 packet (ZooKeeper 3.4.6)

zk-omni-dump: zk+fle+zab sniffer with automatic port detection. this is useful for JUnit testcases where ports are randomly assigned.

usage:
 $ zk-omni-dump
 $ ant -Dtestcase=ReconfigRecoveryTest -D test.method=testCurrentObserverIsParticipantInNewConfig test-core-java

port detection:
 First of all, zk-omni-dump tries to detect FLE.Initial. This detection is easy because structure of FLE.Initial is very simple.
 Then zk-omni-dump learns FLE port and tries to detect FLE.Notification.
 After zk-omni-dump detected FLE.Notification, it parses quorum config string and learn all the ports.

feature(util): parse quorum config string
fix(tests): eliminate confusing usage of LF as 0x0A and SP as 0x20

issue_comments.body:
@rgs1 Thank you for the response!
I will fix it later.

#52 includes all the commits of #51.
Could you review #52 instead of #51, and  close #51 ?

@rgs1 
Thank you a lot for reviewing!
I added some commits to follow your comments.

I use [six](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/six) metaclass for future py3k support.

@rgs1 
Thank you for merging!

@rgs1
LGTM, thanks!
@rgs1 Sorry, I will add tests for this commit and zab-omni-dump soon(today, if possible).

@rgs1

Thank you for the response.
The issue has not been fixed by `ZOOKEEPER-2098`, as `ZOOKEEPER-2098` is not related to the non-buffered `DataOutputStream` used in `QCM.SendWorker`.

https://github.com/apache/zookeeper/blob/0cbc8eee21bda31184d4e7f11100bc0bb300f376/src/java/main/org/apache/zookeeper/server/quorum/QuorumCnxManager.java#L779-781

When corking is enabled, I can get "corked" (i.e., "merged") packets rather than split packets, and zktraffic fails to parse FLE Messages.

A typical "corked" packet is as follows:

```
+------------------------------------------------------------+
| integer length of FLE Message (zktraffic cannot parse this)|
+------------------------------------------------------------+
| FLE Message                                                |
+------------------------------------------------------------+
```

When corking is disabled, the length field gets split from FLE Message field, and zktraffic succeeds to parse FLE Messages.
(Note that zktraffic just ignores the length field with a [`BadPacket("Too small")` exception](https://github.com/twitter/zktraffic/blob/2709b034e22640e64dc9841fe6c53b798a22eaca/zktraffic/fle/message.py#L54-L55). )

Ideally, zktraffic should implement full TCP stack, as the behavior can change in future Zookeeper releases, especially when [`ZOOKEEPER-901`(Redesign of QCM)](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZOOKEEPER-901) gets fixed.
However implementing TCP is very troublesome work. :cry:
